The walk for recovery is a mile long walk to bring together the community and to raise money for local recovery organizations.  As many of you know, the opioid epidemic is an important issue for me and I was honored to take part in the walk this year.

#PA07

I vow to always be an advocate for those in the Lehigh Valley, but I also want to be an advocate for those who are affected by addiction and the opioid epidemic.

#NationalFentanylAwarenessDay

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, in the United States, nearly 107,000 people died as a result of a drug overdose in the 12-month period ending November 2021. And 66% of overdose deaths involved synthetic opioids like fentanyl.

That is why I am running.  I want to save the American Dream and that begins with securing our southern border.  Over the past 12 months, enough fentanyl has come through our southern border to kill every man, woman, and child in this country multiple times over.

When I talk about saving the American Dream, I think about those who lost their lives to fentanyl, who has failed them?  Their American Dream is gone forever.  Who better to deal with this horrendous epidemic than someone who has lived it personally?

which serves to help those in recovery and to end the stigma of being in recovery.  My heart breaks for those who have needlessly lost their lives due to the opioid epidemic and now, the number one killer of Americans aged 18-45 is fentanyl.

Today is #NationalFentanylAwarenessDay .  I have been open about my past struggles with addiction and I am now 40 years clean and sober. I have tried to be a source of hope for those who are struggling themselves.  That is why I helped found Hope and Coffee a coffee shop

On #NationalGoldStarSpousesDay, please remember the loved ones of those who lost their lives serving this country. 

Today, we remember and honor the spouses and their families of our fallen service members. May God bless them.

After all, who can better fight the opioid epidemic than someone who has lived it and has become a voice for those affected by this tragic issue?

#PA07

It is time to get serious about border security and cracking down on illegal drug manufacturers and smugglers.  As your voice in Washington, I will do just that by making this issue a top priority in Congress.

Fentanyl is literally killing hundreds of our neighbors and without action, this trend will not stop.  Just last year, enough fentanyl came across our southern border to kill every man, woman, and child 5x over.

https://t.co/dAwkQtaymJ

Today, I celebrate 40 years of continuous recovery from heroin addiction but in my heart, I know all I have is Today. I look forward to being a strong voice for recovery in Congress and stemming the tide of the opioid epidemic that has taken so many precious American lives
-Lisa https://t.co/pVqxTXk4Th
